title: A Psalm of Praise
shortSummary: Psalm 100 is a joyful call to worship the LORD with gladness, thanksgiving, and praise. It emphasizes God's sovereignty as Creator and Shepherd, highlighting His enduring goodness, mercy, and truth toward His people throughout all generations.
timeline: c. 10th century BC - United Monarchy period, attributed to the time of David or the early temple worship

keyCharacters.name: The LORD
keyCharacters.description: The sovereign God who is praised and worshiped throughout the psalm as Creator, Shepherd, and faithful God.

definitions.definition: A loud, exuberant expression of praise and worship, often through singing or shouting.
A metaphor describing God's people as sheep cared for and protected by God, the good Shepherd.
God's compassionate and forgiving kindness toward sinners.
The steadfast and unchanging faithfulness of God that lasts forever.

outline.heading: Call to Worship with Joy
outline.description: The psalm opens with an invitation to all the earth to make a joyful noise and serve the LORD with gladness, emphasizing worship through singing and joyful service.

outline.heading: Acknowledgment of God’s Sovereignty
outline.description: This section calls the worshiper to recognize the LORD as God, Creator, and Shepherd, affirming the identity of His people as His possession.

outline.heading: Entering God’s Presence with Thanksgiving
outline.description: Believers are encouraged to enter God's presence with thanksgiving and praise, highlighting the importance of gratitude in worship.

outline.heading: Declaration of God’s Character
outline.description: The psalm concludes by affirming God's goodness, everlasting mercy, and enduring truth, providing the foundation for worship and trust.

application: Approach worship with a joyful heart, expressing praise loudly and gladly as an act of service to God.
Recognize and remember that God is the Creator and Shepherd, which calls for humble trust and dependence on Him.
Cultivate a habit of entering God's presence with thanksgiving, acknowledging His blessings in prayer and worship.
Rest in the assurance of God's unchanging goodness, mercy, and faithfulness throughout all generations.

keyVerses.text: Make a joyful noise unto the LORD, all ye lands.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the tone for the entire psalm, inviting all nations to worship God with exuberant joy.

keyVerses.text: Know ye that the LORD he is God: it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes God's sovereignty as Creator and Shepherd, reminding believers of their identity and dependence on Him.

keyVerses.text: For the LORD is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endureth to all generations.
keyVerses.significance: This verse declares the eternal nature of God's goodness, mercy, and faithfulness, providing the foundation for trust and worship.
